bug.author: ibuda
bug.summary: ValueError: Config parameter "html" does not exist.
bug.description:
First of all, I want to thank you for a great product that you've built. I came across it early last year, and it worked like a charm. Yesterday, I tried it again and when I run this generic line: <denchmark-code>profile = ProfileReport(data, title='Pandas Profiling Report', html={'style':{'full_width':True}}) </denchmark-code>
I got the following error: <denchmark-code>--------------------------------------------------------------------------- ValueError Traceback (most recent call last) <ipython-input-27-e5a2e28a7045> in <module> ----> 1 profile = ProfileReport(data, title='Pandas Profiling Report', html={'style':{'full_width':True}})
~/anaconda3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/pandas_profiling/__init__.py in __init__(self, df, **kwargs) 33 34 def __init__(self, df, **kwargs): ---> 35 config.set_kwargs(kwargs) 36 37 # Treat index as any other column
~/anaconda3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/pandas_profiling/config.py in set_kwargs(self, kwargs) 49 50 """ ---> 51 self._set_kwargs(self.config, kwargs) 52 53 def __getitem__(self, item):
~/anaconda3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/pandas_profiling/config.py in _set_kwargs(self, reference, values) 39 reference[key].set(value) 40 else: ---> 41 raise ValueError('Config parameter "{}" does not exist.'.format(key)) 42 43 def set_kwargs(self, kwargs) -> None:
ValueError: Config parameter "html" does not exist. </denchmark-code>
To Reproduce One can reproduce this error by running the following code: <denchmark-code>from sklearn.datasets import load_digits digits = load_digits() X = pd.DataFrame(digits.data) profile = ProfileReport(X, title='Pandas Profiling Report', html={'style':{'full_width':True}}) </denchmark-code>
Version information: python: 3.7.3 pandas_profiling: 2.4.0 All other required modules, I made sure and pip install -r-ed the requirements.txt.

comments.comment:
Ok, I have managed to resolve the issue and this is what I did.
I re-installed the package using `pip install pandas-profiling[notebook,html] (the previous installation was with conda) and the error disappeared. However, another issue appeared once I called profile in jupyter lab:
Lurking through the issues list, I found this solution to the issue from 1., it works like a charm: profile.to_notebook_iframe()
Closing the issue.
I have uninstalled and reinstalled from conda, from source, from pip and I still get this error. python version 3.6.7 pandas_profiling version 2.6.0
